articles.author: Vincent Kearney
articles.title: Foster not briefed about Republic's coronavirus plans
articles.description: Northern Ireland's First Minister has said the Stormont Assembly is disappointed it was not given any prior notice of Leo Varadkar's announcement of a range of new measures to tackle Covid-19.
articles.content:
Northern Ireland's First Minister has said the Stormont Assembly is disappointed it was not given any prior notice of Taoiseach Leo Varadkar's announcement of a range of new measures to tackle Covid-19.

articles.author: Sinéad Brennan
articles.title: Coronavirus helpline sees surge in elderly callers
articles.description: A helpline for older people manned by older volunteers, has seen a surge in concerned calls about the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.content:
A helpline for older people has seen a surge in concerned calls about the coronavirus pandemic.
Senior Line - manned by older volunteers and run by the Third Age Foundation - has noted an estimated 85% increase in calls, with the coronavirus the main topic o… [+708 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Taoiseach: 'I need to speak to you about Coronavirus'
articles.description: The full text of Taoiseach Leo Varadkar's statement, as he announces that schools, colleges and childcare facilities will close until 29 of March because of Covid-19.
articles.content:
Taoiseach Leo Varadkar has announced that schools, colleges and childcare facilities will close until 29 of March because of Covid-19.
But he said shops are to remain open.
He said restaurants should consider how best to introduce social distancing.

articles.title: Three Leicester players showing symptoms of coronavirus
articles.description: Three Leicester players have shown symptoms of the coronavirus and have been kept away from the squad, manager Brendan Rodgers has said.
articles.content:
Three Leicester players have shown symptoms of the coronavirus and have been kept away from the squad, manager Brendan Rodgers has said.

articles.description: The National Basketball Association is suspending the season until further notice after a Utah Jazz player tested positive for the coronavirus.
articles.content:

articles.title: WH Smith sees £40m profit hit from coronavirus
articles.description: Retailer WH Smith said the impact of coronavirus on its stores in airports, stations and the high street could hit its full-year underlying profit by between £30m and £40m.
articles.content:
Retailer WH Smith said the impact of coronavirus on its stores in airports, stations and the high street could hit its full-year underlying profit by between £30m and £40m.
